intro: Strychnos afzelii, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a flowering plant belonging to the Loganiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds covered in a silky coating. It is often found in forested areas and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
